msContents.summary:
28 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 8; Qurʾānic Text: Q 4:127-7:171; 18-19 lines per page; Dimensions: 245 x 184mm; Script style: kūfī B.Ib.
This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 8
Fragment: 4:126(127) – 7:170(171).
28 fol. 184×245 mm (1.345). Support: parchment, thin, rigid, transparent, yellowish. Writing material: dark-brown ink.
Collation: three quires
I: H1F H2F F3H / F4H F5H F6H F7H F8H, all are bifolia except ff. 7 and 8 that have been trimmed along the fold and lost their counterfolios.
II: H9F H10F F11H H12F S F13H / F14H F15H S F16H F17H F18H;
III: H19F H20F F21H H22F S F23H / F24H S F25H F26H F27H F28H.
Text layout: 18 lines (fol. 1–22), 19 lines (fol. 23–28), 125×200 mm (1.6). Ruling: absent. Script: B Ib. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: red dots.
Verse markers: individual verses – diagonal dashes (type 1.1.1); groups of 5 verses – a “shoe-shaped” letter ا (alif) in red and green colour drawn over the markers of individual verses, used sporadically; groups of 10 verses – two red concentric circles (type 1.A.I or 1.D.I), in some cases – a red circle with letter و (wāw).
Markers for rub‘ an khums divisions are written in the outer margin in brown (or green?) ink:: الخمس الاول (fol. 9v); الربع الاول (fol. 21r).
A headband (primitive and probably of a later date) is drawn before surah 6 in the upper margin of fol. 12v, in green paint an ink.
Surah titles are written in red:
Surah 5 – فـاـتحه سورة التي يذكر فيها المـايدة وهي ماية اية واثنين وعشرين اية (fol. 3v);
Surah 6 – الانعام و هي مائة وستة وستين اية فـاـتحه سورة التي يذكر فيها (fol. 12r);
Surah 7 – فـاـتحه سورة التي يذكر فيها الأعراف وهي مائتين وخمس ايات (fol. 21r).
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures. On the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).
Old conservation: separate words have been overwritten, text corrected (fol. 28r) in black ink.
Defects: small stains, ink has peeled of in some places.
Old accession numbers: A. 8(?) (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–4v. Surah 4, verses 126(127) – 175(176)*. Incipit: [تنكحوهنّ وا]لمستضعفين.
Fol. 3v–12r. Surah 5
Fol. 12r–21r. Surah 6
Fol. 21r–28v. Surah 7, verses 1(1) – 170(171). Explicit: واقعٌ بهم خُذُ[وا ما اتيناكم] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
